text:
My first visit to La Tour d‚ÄôArgent on New Year‚Äôs Eve. We made the choice to leave the year 2021 behind, to start 2022 for the better new year.  We arrived at 8 pm. On the ground floor, they were many staff welcoming us to the restaurant which I think La Tour d‚ÄôArgent isn‚Äôt just a restaurant but they pack with all the legendary clients photos and clients signature cards collection on the wall heading to the elevator , I am feeling, I was walking into a place full with the legendary guests on the wall. I am feeling so special to be able to come so far from home to Paris.
We took the elevator up to the restaurant area with a live singer and band playing music all night, very festive! We have the set menu for new year and i am glad to have this: every dish is so so fresh and delicious. Let me tell you about the service, the staff are very friendly, they know not to interrupt you during all the night and also made everything so smooth, I am feeling comfortable and enjoy food although conversation like sitting at my own home.

Once in a lifetime experience so it's difficult to rank appropriately. Obviously the aesthetics and service were unbelievable. Definitely feels like a three Michelin star white glove experience.

The duck courses were fantastic and highly unusual which was a rare plus. The wine list is larger than an encyclopedia and is thrilling. All wines are at least 100 euros but given that, honestly, the selection of 20+ year old wine under 200 euros is impressive.

The cheese cart and desserts are both can't miss items. Not for every visit to Paris but at least once in a lifetime!

A beautiful restaurant with an extremely long tradition.  extremely creative cuisine.  rich wine cellar.  Wonderful staff.  A divine view of Notre Dame. At the end of lunch they give you a gift souvenir  of a glass goose.

Best meal I had in Paris. Everything was perfection. The wait staff were exceptional. Got a small glimpse of the kitchen because the normal lift for the restaurant was broken. That was neat. It felt like we were being let in a secret VIP entrance. A night I will remember.

Overall, a great experience. The duck was exquisite. History of this place is mind-blowing & we had a beautiful view of the River Seine.
We had the tasting menu. They failed to ask about any food allergies however which is surprising considering the calibre of the restaurant. Even the most basic restaurants always ask this question.
I let the server know of my shell fish allergy & they did accommodate for us eventually, however, not without causing a minor raucous.
Also caused a minor raucous that we did not drink alcohol & declined the champagne.
The restaurant could improve with acknowledging & being prepared people's different food & lifestyle preferences, otherwise a great experience.

#40 follow my Michelin Stars Marathon reviews on Googlemaps list
On top of the world!

If you‚Äôre French, sitting in la Tour d Argent, you‚Äôre feeling like you‚Äôre on top of the world‚Ä¶ and you are since you have a magnificent view over, what we French consider as the world: Paris and Notre Dame.
I know what you‚Äôre going to say: it‚Äôs expensive. You‚Äôre right. It is. Is it really though ? The lunch menu is less than a very average 3 stars hotel in the city center. Which memories will last a lifetime? A meal at La Tour or an hotel night in a very average place?
I had the good fortune of speaking with the manager of the group (they also have a bakery -aka ‚Äúoh my god those croissants are so good‚Äù, and an epicerie ). Interestingly, the difference with the others famous star Michelin in Paris, is that the proportion of none Parisian French customers is uniquely higher, allowing them to reopen way before the other big names. It does make sense. I wouldn‚Äôt live in Paris, why wouldn‚Äôt I eat in a place where I enjoy Paris, a great cuisine and an impeccable service?
Still, for the French, we save this restaurant for the ‚Äúgrandes occasions‚Äù, exceptional events like engagement, diplomas, etc‚Ä¶ well, I‚Äôm living 2 mn walk from the place, I feel like I need to more exceptional event in my life‚Ä¶
So when I went, the restaurant patrons were mainly French, which is really different from other place I went (see my review on Septime). To make it short, if you want to be amongst wealthy French, now you know the address.
Which brings me to another point: the dressing code/mood. You ll receive an email after you booked reminding you that you should dress properly. Well, I think it‚Äôs important because I think there are places, where it‚Äôs great when all the patrons are well dressed. Being well dressed, it‚Äôs not only important for your experience, but also for the others, as you‚Äôre participating in creating an unique memory. I would feel as I m not respecting the other patrons (especially the couples) moment by not dressing up. I saw some French guy in chic, yet slightly casual, I was about to call the fashion police on them!
One last thing, don‚Äôt worry about it being to ¬´ formal ¬´ , the waiters will know how to put you at ease. It‚Äôs the quality of all the good Michelin Stars waiters, nice enough to be at ease, distant enough to feel respected. Here you have la cr√®me de la cr√®me.
But what about the food, I hear you wondering. It‚Äôs true that the setting, the history and the service will first occupy your mind. But then, you wonder if the cuisine will be up to the same level. The task is incredibly difficult. You went to be classical, yet haute cuisine, with some innovations (but not too much). The chef, who is a ‚Äúmeilleur ouvrier de France ‚Äú (like ‚Äútop chef‚Äù, but before, without cameras and really focus on the cuisine‚Ä¶) manages to avoid the traps, and delivers beautifully. He manages to get out alive of this culinary ‚Äúmine field ‚Äú. Look at my pictures. It‚Äôs as good as it looks. It‚Äôs perfectly executed, coherent, balanced and perfectly in line with the rest of the experience. Which is another fit in itself.

It‚Äôs a very well deserved star, a top tiers one star.
It‚Äôll create memories, that‚Äôll you speak about years later. And I need to find a good reason to go back!

La perfection üëåüèª
This is perfection ! The only possible comment on this experience !
It was my dream to enjoy a meal at this epic place, institution I would say.
And dreams come true.
Amazing experience. Over the top. The service, the view, the food ! 5*!

The La Tour d'Argent is the oldest restaurant in Paris (1582). Impecable and courteous service from the front door to the table. The chef offers a culinary experience. The Gran Livre de Vin is in the true sense of the word "grand". The restaurant over looks the Seine with Notre Dame in the distance. Our time there was very enjoyable and  memorable. If I were to something different, I would make a reservation just sunset.
Had a wonderful experience! No doubt it‚Äôs become my favorite restaurant in Paris! Best duck ever ü¶Ü
Great C√¥te de b≈ìuf paired with Graves Wine. Staff was lovely, and we had a good time. Will be back without hesitation.

I‚Äôm sure the Tour d‚Äôargent is great but the Rotisserie needs improvement. Such simple cuisine is only good when the people who prepare are super careful and know what they are doing. They employ too many apprentices who treat the job like MacDo. Please, that‚Äôs not fair to us diners. We all can roast a chicken at home. We expect La Tour staff to cook each one to perfection, otherwise what‚Äôs the point? Food was OK, our waiter great, other staff were not fit for such a restaurant and should not only focus on their job but also not stare at guests!

La Tour d'Argent remains one of the best restaurants in the world; the location and view (especially on a beautiful Parisian Spring day like we had) are unparalleled.  The food and presentation were amazing, and the wine (under Antoine's expert tutelage) was exceptional. We cannot wait for our next visit.

An excellent way to spend a lunchtime. The views are magnificent, the wine list extraordinary, the food delicious, and the service perfectly unobtrusive. Thank you very much to the chef and the teams.
Solid traditional food and a great location.
Delicious food, friendly staff, great experience,

Terrible experience at the Rotisserie today
22/05 , I was so very much looking forward to finishing my trip in this restaurant which used to be fantastic and ended up having a terrible experience yet super expensive for what it was. I was looking forward to order a foie grass and a duck confit but I understood that there is an issue due to the duck fever, I ended up ordering the overpriced roasted chicken which  was served totally cold, I had to send it back and the waiter did not even apologise, he returned with the same piece of chicken reheated. It is extremely disappointing for the prices you are charging this should not be happening.

Not sure I will be visiting again

This place is completely racist and staff has no horeca skills whatsoever. My wife was not allowed to use toilet while we waited for a table next to the bridge. Waiter declined service since we were only to take some wine and snacks. Do not recommend

We were impressed with the quality of the food and service.  Our waiter had a wonderful sense of humor and made us feel very welcome.  We were seated by the window and had a good view of the Seine.  Before leaving, we were offered and enjoyed an aged Sauterne "on the house" because we were such a cute couple.  It was our last night in Paris so we left the city with a wonderful memory.

Tour d'Argent advertises exceptional view and star cuisine. The view is great.

The food, we had the 6 course menu, is unfortunately not. The appetizers a slice of salmon, a scoop of duck foie gras with jelly, and caviar on cream cheese are boring without refined flavors. In the main course of fish with spinach, the fish was less convincing than the caramelized seafood. The meat dish a slice of duck stuffed with duck foie gras (again) came with a heavily salted sauce. The dessert was lemon souffl√© served with lemon sorbet. The souffl√© was well risen in the top third, unfortunately it still had a whole solid block of raw dough in the bottom two thirds.

The service seemed completely unimpressed with our still-filled plates when we returned them.

This restaurant is overall not very neat and clean. For example, dirty chairs with obvious food residue were conspicuous.

It was a dream for me as youngster to eat at this monument restaurant located in very authentic Parisienne area, actually it was a dream to many to be in the same restaurant where they ate in it almost all famous kings, presidents and leaders and personalities from around the planet since it was founded in 1582, yes you heard that right since 439 years ago and The location Quai de la Tournelle, where the restaurant stands, was not paved until the year 1650, before which it was "a slope, often flooded and almost always made inaccessible by mud...... I booked 4 months in advance to our trip to Paris and paid a deposit to book the table and here I am with my date my lovely wife
We choose our table at the window facing the river and it couldn‚Äôt be more romantic than that view,
The food was exceptional and the wine list was amazing and I guess one of a kind in the planet since the thickness it was like 2 phone books attached together and the service was outstanding and professional and mostly the butler,,, Obviously
We enjoyed the whole evening the appetizers, the main course and the dessert and most of all the 1999 bottle of French wine,
After the dinner the manager showed us around where we look at the pictures of kings and presidents has been and ate at this same place (like us) :)
Wonderful service and the best chicken I've ever had. Cannot recommend enough.

Very bad experience for me.
First of all, it was very hard to order our food and wine because nobody was looking at us for a long time. We ordered a bottle of wine but it was never delivered, so we had to change the order(and that was very difficult as well because nobody was paying attention to diners inside). Although we reserved more than a month ago, everybody was busy for terrace seats. At the end of the meal, my silverwares were clearly pointing I'm in the middle of eating but a person who seems to be the manager just took the dish not even asking I was finished or not.
For the price, I would probably go somewhere else.  Everything was good -- and the chicken main course and egg appetizer were great -- but you can get much better food in Paris for less money.
A great place for dinner while La Tour d'Argent is being renovated.  Nice casual atmosphere, great service, food very well prepared and a nice wine list.
Disappointed in the food & the staff. Limited menu. Steak very tough. Slow service. Had looked forward to this visit again.

We had an exceptional experience at the Tour d'Argent one Saturday evening. The view was perfect ‚Äî we were seated by the window ‚Äî and everything we ordered was delicious. They have one of the most impressive wine cellars in the world. The wine list was literally the size of an encyclopaedia. The sommelier knew it by heart and recommended the perfect pairings, which were not necessarily the most expensive bottles on the list. Tour d'Argent is obviously very, very pricey, but it's a once in a lifetime experience, best shared with amazing company to complement the setting, the service and the food.

Wine wine wine wine. We went there twice during our trip. The food is spectacular but you are here for one of the best wine lists the world has seen. Be patient and search carefully as you will find stunners and that you will talk about the rest of your life. The staff and service are spectacular though I think they were taken back by the amount of wine we purchased . We drank every last drop! I am betting they thought we were gonna leave a bunch..

Disappointing experience all around. The ma√Ætre de was unwelcoming and seemed irritated by our request to move tables even though the restaurant was practically empty.  Our waiter was inattentive, slow and had a major attitude. Our wine came after our meals and we had to remind him multiple times. The food was fine but nothing very special. Chicken was dry. We noted in the reservation this was to celebrate my mom's 80th birthday and they made no mention of it. Don't waste a meal here - there are too many other great places in Paris to try.

To be or not to be emotional ... Probably one of the most well known Restaurant in the world : La Tour d'Argent. I have been leaving in Paris since years and never had to real opportunity to go in this restaurant.   My first experience was just exceptional and emotional. First the location is simply outstanding downtown Paris with a view of Notre Dame (At the time I am posting the comments the drama of Notre Dame has happened). The river "la Seine" . The  charming interior is great and there is a diamond down the building : the cellar is just crazy - an outstanding experience when you take the time to visit and get the all story . Then the service and the dinner were simply all great from the beginning until the end. I did not have the opportunity to try the specialty "Canard au sang" but I will definitively remember this experience. Thank you Chef Philippe Labb√©.

Valentine's menu was preprepared and mediocre. No actual cooking involved, just heating things up.

Aggressively tries to sell their own overpriced Champagne.

Two glasses of a young Sauterne cost 20,- each, no warning given.

Maybe it's better during a normal weekday, but for the money we ended up spending there are plenty of nicer places than this in Paris.

All in all, militantly commercial with little to back it up

La Tour d'Argent is one of the finest restaurants in the world.  The decor, ambience and views are spectacular.  The food, wine and service is second to no other restaurant.  It is a restaurant that everyone must experience at least once (or more) in his/her lifetime!
Amazing experience. Beautiful terrace and splendid food.

An incredible venue as well as deluxe gourmet experience. We had the "Tour d'argent" menu which combines the best of the Maison : caviar, foie gras, duck, Saint Pierre... as delicate for the palate as it is to look at, a real
beautiful presentation. The 180 degrees view on the Seine is just magical... Will definitely return.
Fantastic french bistro with 5 stars classic french fare. Had a whole duck served as two courses which was spectacular. Best to get there with an empty stomach. Highly recommended

If you have a chance I strongly recommend to go to this restaurant. They serve traditional duck dish. If you order duck you will get certification card which numbering they served duck. And my favorite one their dish is crape. As I know thief crape is best in the world.
Great food, excellent service. We didn't speak the language and brought kids. Everything was perfect.

*The following constitutes my opinion only deriving from personal observations and experience with intention to subjectively describe the experience of specific persons. All information in this post constitutes my opinion only and must not be viewed as slander or defamatory.
---Context: We made a reservation 2 months prior to our dinner experience to ensure our seating as well as our food specificities were met with ease by the establishment. Having dined there 4 times, we thought it a great idea to spend Christmas eve at the Tour D‚ÄôArgent. As a renowned restaurant of this stature, one expects the kitchen and servers to be prepared not only for the regular customer, but for requests that are made well in advance and accepted by the restaurant management. We emailed twice and received confirmation emails from their part, and called on the day, to reconfirm that we wished to be seated on the left-hand side of the restaurant, preferably near a window and most importantly, that one guest needed for the Christmas set menu (360 EUR per person) to be adapted to fully gluten free, dairy free and sugar free.
---Attention to guests/requests: We were hoping the chef, having had 2.5 months to prep something worth 360 EUR for the gluten free, dairy free and sugar free guest would be prepared to surprise us with the high-level cuisine expected. Instead, the gluten free bread was rubber (when one can easily order fresh, tasty gluten free bread in Paris). One of the dishes was an exclusively cheese dish for which they had zero replacement options prepared. When we confronted the waiters with this, they answered ‚Äúthe dairy free request was just only mentioned by you at your arrival so the chef has no replacements for the dish, but I can give you 3 salad leaves with vinaigrette‚Äù (yes, 3 regular lettuce leaves on a plate). When I confronted him again, telling him that I could also put 3 leaves onto a plate and that I was expecting more from them, he came back with a plate of nothing but (half raw?) artichoke that was so bad it was left untouched upon the first bite. Then, the gluten free, dairy free and sugar free dessert, was cut fruit. The cut fruit you find in hotel rooms when you check in. Paris has an abundance of ‚Äúchef patissier‚Äù who can use sweeteners with a variety of non-dairy milks to make real deserts, as long as you inform them of these requirements a few days in advance. We know this because we‚Äôve been to many establishments who make the effort to create something for their guest and chefs take pride in showing their know-how. After 2 months of potential prep time, they had nothing but an improvised fruit plate.
---Service: wrong drinks served on the first round, then wrong water. The waiters then forgot to give us cutlery, twice. We had to raise our hand and ask for cutlery. Then we had to ask for them to take our plates back on one occasion, after we had finished for a solid 10 minutes.
It was Christmas eve and it felt like they knew they were getting their 360 EUR per person anyway, regardless of the service and the gastronomic experience offered. For example, when the  artichoke or fruit plate remained untouched, we weren‚Äôt even asked if something was wrong with the dishes; they simply took them back and charged us fully for those two dishes, without any apology or comment.
---Seating: we were seated in the exact opposite side of the restaurant: we asked for left, they seated us on the right side. When I asked whether booking a year in advance would change something, he said it wouldn‚Äôt/ we would still not be ‚Äúguaranteed‚Äù seating. Odd‚Ä¶it felt like we weren‚Äôt important enough to get the other side of the restaurant/others were prioritised.
---Conclusive thoughts: having recommended this place to my family and having flown them to Paris specially to spend Christmas Eve in the Tour D‚ÄôArgent, I excused myself and experienced anxiety in the bathroom for around 10 minutes after all the above took place. I have had okay experiences here in the past, but this last one was disappointing.
Wow, what an experience! Obviously, the food and wine are out of this world, but the tradition and  service are also something very, very special. Thank you for the most amazing day.

While La Rotisserie D‚ÄôArgent may be the little sister of La Tour D‚ÄôArgent, which is famous for its duck and a commanding view of Notre Dame from the Left Bank, there is nothing diminutive about La Rotisserie‚Äôs food or service. Friends and I had a lovely and leisurely lunch while visiting Paris in mid-January. Everything we ordered was prepared and presented with care and thoughtfulness, and the service was efficient, friendly, and attentive. We never felt hurried or overlooked, even though we were the last lunch party to leave before closing to prepare for dinner service later that evening.

La Rotisserie offers a sublime and award-winning ‚Äúoeuf mayo.‚Äù I chose one of the daily specials for my main course: a beautifully seared and succulent pork chop, which was served with mustard sauce and potatoes. To finish your meal, you can enjoy either a house dessert (a friend had the cr√®me brulee ‚Äì stunningly smooth) or try one of the daily delights from the adjacent Boulangerie de la Tour. My Boulangerie selection reminded me of Paris Brest. However, instead of hazelnut cr√®me, I dove into a pecan cr√®me that surrounded a luscious caramel center, all nestled between two clouds of choux.

With its bright and airy interior, a bustling but never rushed atmosphere, and a location across the street from the banks of the Seine (ideal for a post-lunch or dinner stroll), La Rotisserie offers a delicious dining experience that is one of the pleasures of being in Paris.

Good food, good service, and reasonable prices. My personal recommendation would have to be the escargots, although the half duck is also delicious. But don't forget to leave some space for dessert, as the creme Brulee and the raspberry tartalette are incredible.

It was lovely and delicious. The duck is always exceptional.
They take care of every detail to offer a beautiful experience!!

Same family owns the Michelin starred Paris institution La Tour d‚ÄôArgent across the street. The rotisserie delivers warm, friendly yet professional service. Lovely venue facing Quai de la Tournelle. Large handicapped accessible bathroom on same floor is a plus in Paris. Get the duck or the chicken for the classics. The food is absolutely delicious. You can order dessert from the Tour D‚ÄôArgent‚Äôs brilliant Tarterie next door or try the rotisserie‚Äôs special desserts. Walk it off along the Seine and find Notre Dame just a few steps away. Perfect. Note they are even open on Sunday afternoon.

I grew up in Paris so this restaurant always held a special place in my imagination.

We visited two weeks ago on a Sunday for lunch where I wanted to treat my parents, my partner and a close friend of ours to something special and we had such a wonderful time. The dishes, the service, the wine, the view... Everything contributed to making this visit truly unforgettable.

Big thank you to the team who were looking after us, it was perfect!
Never a wrong choice. Impecable toujours.

Top service and even better food. Worth the price, we had the canneton for two served in two services, the half black legged chicken (they even gave us an extra serving of the roasting juice!!) And the half crossed duck from Challans. We were so stuffed at the end that we didn't even had dessert. Their bread is top notch as well. Imo the canneton was the best so go in pairs.
Thoroughly enjoyed the evening at La Rotisserie! Food was tasty and we sat out on the terrace over-looking the Seine on a lovely balmy evening!
Epic meal. A tour de force. Fantastic flavor , ambience and service.  Will be coming back again whenever we are in paris
We had a great lunch there. The service was great,  dishes were excellent(the menu d√©jeuner) with an awesome view even it was cloudy, a little bit disappointed with my chocolate dessert though.

Our dining experience celebrating my husband‚Äôs birthday was amazing. This was our second time at the restaurant. Our first experience was on our honeymoon in 2006. Thank you for a marvelous time and fantastic meal and awesome service.

Without a doubt the most exquisite dining experience I've ever had and am likely to ever have. Every element of the evening was superb. Thank you so much to every member of the team for making our evening such a phenomenal experience!

Excellent place. Such a wonderful restaurant. The view, the Grand Si√®cle ambience, the impeccable staff (some in tailcoats !) and the outstanding food -  traditional and yet innovative . What a pity the customers do not make an effort to match the elegance of the place and its superb class. We had altogether an exquisite lunch and plan and hope to return soon. This is Paris the way we love it and we hope this historic place will continue to thrive in the future. The Tour d‚ÄôArgent and its cuisine are a proud example why UNESCO declared french cuisine an intangible world heritage . Un grand merci!

A fine dining restaurant with a beautiful view and a lovely atmosphere. Attention to detail and amazing service from the waiters. Picture of the wine list posted. Its a landmark and one of the oldest restaurants in Paris but they only had a french menu so the waiter translated and it made it a bit tough to order and you didnt really know what you were getting until it came.

Not the Tour d'Argent so no view of the river, relaxed not formal service etc *but* cheaper food, still high quality, and good wine list. Our bottle of 'house brand' burgundy was excellent value at around 40 euro, for example. Lovely meal, with perfectly cooked duck breast and beef fillet, and lemon tart & cr√®me br√ªl√©e that could not be faulted. Highly *highly* recommended.

We had lunch here and were seated at -the- best table without asking to be. The view is amazing. The service is excellent and attentive. It was a truly special meal and something we‚Äôll be recommending to friends. I hope we have the chance to return in the future.
The restaurant has good food, specially the whole duck, nevertheless it's not worth the price.
La Tour is a magnificent restaurant and a true Parisian institution, in the best sense. The wine list is truly a thing to behold and everything we ate was simply sublime. A wonderful experience.
Superb. The food was exquisite. Our chicken and duck were cooked perfectly, and the sauces were sublime. Finishing the meal with mille-feuille was perfect. Brava.
It was really nice experience here. The starter was ok for me but the main dishes and dessert was really really good. The staff are kind

Four well deserved stars, the staff was friendly, almost familiar and they know their stuff without blinking - yes some of the food can feel outdated, but it never lacked in flavor or passion, the lobby needs the same love as everything else does - it seems a little worn out and empty in this gem of a restaurant.

me and my family was slightly nervous about meeting a snobbish, old-school French restaurant, but was extremely pleasantly surprised by the staff and food - world class.
Thank you so much for the meal and the experience
Everything was exquisite and the service was flawless!
The chicken and potatoes were excellent. Friendly, prompt service too.

they do duck right.
It is worth a trip and even if you find the food okay, you‚Äôll be happy with the staff, the service, the wine, the view, the history, and the whole experience.
Always a classic of high cuisine and if you love wine - get ready to browse their extensive carte
They should make it clear on their website that duck is not available until autumn due to bird flu
Great experience! Food was delicious, had a Cote de Boef for 2 and it was tender and very tasty. Service also very good, always concerned about the customer. Will definetly come back.

Wonderful duck two ways!

The service was very attentive. We ordered the duck for two (for three of us). You can see your duck roasting on their rotisserie grilling wall. Once it‚Äôs ready they bring it out for you to see before carving it.

The first course was slices of the roasted duck. The skin was crispy with an assortment of spices. The meat was moist and cooked medium rare. The red wine soaked plum added fruitiness. The diced potatoes with nuts and parsley was buttery with a nice crunch.

The second course was more of a confit of the remaining duck. The gravy was the highlight here.

We also ordered the escargot which was good as expected.

Would recommend a visit during your stay in Paris! Bon appetit!

La Tour d'Argant is a historic insitution. It keeps a retro atmosphere and that is why we love it and have no other comments than "thank you". Service-wise, impecable: waiters and waitresses are kind, caring, knowledgeable, discrete and agile as ballet-dancers. The menu is a classic and made of classics of French cuisine: if you come here, that is what you would expect to find and will find without disappointment. Unfortunately, some sour notes: 1. two glasses of champagne were ordered (Veuve Cliquot) and were delivered from a pre-opened bottle (at least a cuple of days before). Despite of what the sommelier tried to explain, this is a fact: perlage was absent/not existing and any bouquet/tast had faded away. this is unecceptable. Of ocurse, the two glasses were not charged on our bill.. but still this should never happen; 2. a big fishbone was in my sole. This could happen, but it CANNOT happen in place like la tour d'argent.

Food, service, view were all superb.  We were celebrating our 45th anniversary, a year and a half late courtesy of Covid.  La Tour d'Argent made our visit memorable.  Our whole experience from arrival to departure was unparalleled.
A Parisian classic. The service is impeccable. Book well in advance to get the windows. This is the biggest wine list I have ever seen. Order the duck in any form.

Wauw, this restaurant is an absolute experience. Once you entrance the beautiful building at you feel royal! There is 'liftboy', a waiting area, a seat for your bag and a lot more of these extraordinary services.. The food is good, the service is pleasant but the winelist is absolutaly impressive... More than 230.000 wines, a lot of old vintages and a female sommelier (I like). The building itself and the interior can use a little upgrade here and there.. That's the only reason I rate this restaurant with 4 stars, but if you are a gastronomique or wine addict? This place should be on your list!
Total pampering  by the team of maitres and servers. The 20 pound wine book is a joy to peruse through. And the duck specialty is magnificent as it has been for more than a century.
Incredibly kind and patient staff and best croissant I‚Äôve had

Excellent place. I forgot how good the attention and food was. Excellent price-quality balance, a bit more expensive than any average brasserie but well worth the price. The 2nd plate in the duck serving for 2 people, could improve the mustard sauce as it is a bit harsh and a clear downfall from the 1st serving which is absolutely delicious. Recommended!
Great service, great food - roast pork and roti poulet were excellent
Wonderful food, great place. Expensive but I guess that was expected
Get the roast chicken and thank me later. Served table side with au jus.

Hurrendous  welcome‚Ä¶ would not accept our NHS covid certificates when it states clearly on the french government website that this is satisfactory.  It clearly says certificate or QR!  This same certificate was accepted from us by passport control, the Bristol Hotel where we were residing & every other restaurant we dined in during this trip, including Lasserre & 114 at the Bristol, so to say they were invalid is nonsense.  I don‚Äôt think we would‚Äôve got through border control otherwise!!  We were really looking forward to this lunch & couldn‚Äôt be any more disappointed.  Anyone coming from abroad, stay clear!  Seems they make their own rules here, certainly different from everywhere else in Paris!  We have been in the past, but certainly will never be back!
Simply the best! A must try and you will never regret it. Actually the only regret is if you forget to make your next reservation!!

I love this restaurant for several reasons. It's old school. The patrons dress so nicely. It's a romantic place with a great view. Food is great. And while I like Italian red wine over French red, I've never seen such a deep French wine list.

Was excited to try the roasted duck - a bit disappointed. Breast slightly overcooked but also strangely watery. Another guest had their rib steak medium-rare - came out well-done. Had to send it back. Nice ambiance and waiters - but just not good enough for the prices they charge.
Friendly modern bistro with excellent food, great service, and reasonable prices
Great experience right on the water! The staff are very welcoming and helpful, and the food is great!

I first visited the Tour over forty years ago when Claude Terrail was the owner. It was wonderful then. It is even better now under his son, Andre. Yes, it is expensive, but the experience is like nothing else, the restaurant, the unique view, possibly the best in Paris, and the sense of occasion. The food is better than ever. The starters were as good as anything in Paris, London, or New York, light, imaginative and full of flavour. We had the famous duck for our main course. It's wonderful but, dare I say it,  less exciting than the other dishes. Next time I go I shall have something else, something which gives rein to the potential of a chef at the top of his game. Lastly, so many places like this are stuffy and formal. The Tour is the opposite. Nowhere has more charming staff.

Amazing food and very friendly, attentive and thoughtful service. I am a vegetarian (not that easy in France!) but they thoughtfully adapted dishes for me without my even having to ask.
The view is fantastic, despite the poor Lady being in distress currently.
Eye-wateringly expensive but would definitely go again.
Lovely place, good food, good service, overall 5 stars.
Excellent food and service in a lovely location.  Definitely recommended.
What a nice restaurant! Location TOP. Food amazing and the service super nice, this restaurant is a "must" if you are planning to visit Paris.

Well, I'm not going back to *this* place.

I'm not going to get the best meal of my life again, and I'm not going to do it on another beautiful evening. I'm certainly not going to have impeccable service, with everything in perfect place. There definitely won't be the chance to let the chef choose the meal again, allowing each dish to work in harmony with its predecessor. I'm not going to have the opportunity to let an expert sommelier recommend the perfect wines from a cellar of half a million bottles, and then find that those two carefully chosen bottles are excellent accompaniments for every course. I definitely won't get fantastic dishes at every turn that tease my palate with contrasting sights, textures, flavors, and aromas.

An unforgettable experience. The meal of a life time. Exquisite dining. Peerless presentation.
Jeffrey K. Zeig, Ph.D.
The Milton Erickson Foundation
A lovely restaurant for lunch with tasty, simply prepared food.  A cute place with friendly servers, and a superb view of the Seine and Ile St Louis.  Good price quality ratio as well.
Flawless. The sommelier enabled me to depart from my usual wines, burgundy, bordeaux, and rh√¥ne, and drink a wonderful Languedoc that I would never have found in their unmatched wine list.

Think it is a wonderful plan to have tables over by the river and so well spaced.  Delicious food as always and the service was impeccable.  A big thank you for having this available in these difficult times
Excellent experience. Warm service and comfortable environment.

Incredible service and attention to detail.  Meal was absolutely amazing.  View is spectacular.  Finally I made the reservation 3 months in advance and noted it was to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday.  They remembered and brought us a discrete extra dessert treat.
An exceptionnal night as planned : world-class service, with a fine touch of humour, amazing menu imagination, and astonishign view on the roofs of Paris.
Outstanding place and food. If you're in Paris and like having a very good French dinner with a superb view, this is the place. A must.

Perfection in every detail starting with the presentation of your wine selection: presentation, protocol in opening, filtering & transferring to a vessel. Followed by each course, cooked exactly as ordered & accompanied with the perfect sauce for the dish.  Dinning perfection

We booked a table outside near the river and it was amazing. The fries tasted like In-N-Out fries. We had two different orders of duck and they were great. This is one of the top restaurants in my book in Paris.

This was simply the best dining experience I have ever had. The attention to detail and customer service was amazing and the food and setting is just outstanding. Thank you for making a special occasion perfect.
Should try the food. Please make reservation.

Perfect sequence of dishes. From the minute you're greeted at the door until you step a foot outside the service is impeccable. Really great food and the wine list is to die for. If you can't find the wine you're looking for here, then it does not exist. Great view of Notre Dam from the dining room. We were lucky to be allowed on the cellar and it was an unbelievable experience. The history, service and amazing food make this restaurant a "bucket list" item.
Delicious dinner! The Maitre was very helpful and always with a smile, the staff efficient and discreet. Perfect food, served in a cozy ambience, with French savoir-faire at its best. Unmissable!

Loved the experience.. we just walked in and had no idea the place will be so nice.. it was actually the last dinner before leaving Paris and couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better one.. the food and the staff  was just perfect.. if you visit do have the duck..
The duck is as good as everyone says it is. Don't leave there without trying it!

Horrible experience and customer service. Showing up with our son was the equivalent of showing up with a three headed dog. They had no problem taking our money in advance though. There are definitely better places with a more personable staff and beautiful views in Paris. Don't waste your time here.

Always Delicious and Wonderful, is a must to eat here, it was the favorite restaurant of my grandparents and since the day I eat with them here has become my favorite reataurante as well. All this years and still the best place to eat in Paris, a must when you visit this  beautiful city !
The food is Delicious. Excellent atmosphere and the final touch is the beautiful view of the city. Congratulations for maintaining the good quality and we always recommended to eat here, we loved it üëçüëè
Soooooo delicious. ü§© Super recommend.

Was a great memorable family experience!! Just the day before this resturant we went to a 3 Michelin star resturant and really did t like it. However, this place was amazing! Our kiddos loved the food and it‚Äôs not easy to get your kids to eat great food:) If you want amazing food and beautiful view of Paris definitely a must!

As an avid wine lovee, I simply can't love this historical restaurant more. Reading the wine list, which consists of every bottle of French wine you could think of, is an absolute pleasure.

In terms of food, I found everything generally delicate, delicious but not as surprising as other starred restaurants, but I'd not blame it for this. Generally speaking, I think this place is a must-go, not just for the food, but for the richness of history and wine.

We LOVED our experience at Rotisserie d'Argent.  We had just spent a week in Burgundy and wanted a true French experience without being so rich - the spit chicken and the duck were devine -  service was wonderful and everything about it made it one of our favorites
Stunning venue and view, exquisite dining, impeccable service ... five stars all around! And many thanks for handling our reservation mishap so elegantly.

Horrible. We went there to celebrate my wife becoming a partner in her law firm. They tried to scam us for viciously expensive wine we'd neither ordered nor drunk. Trying to get it off the bill was a nightmare. The manager "wasn't available",  they tried keeping me waiting round in the hope that I'd give up and pay. I was repeatedly asked if I wanted to keep waiting for the manager who "wasn't available". The waiters tried to stare me out.
Eventually the manager gave up being "not available" and accepted they'd tried to rip us off.
No, of course he didn't apologise, his attitude was that this was standard and I should have put up with the rip off.
I wasn't all that impressed by the food either.
Avoid.
The evening was ruined
What a wonderful restaurant! So delicious!
A very special place with the most amazing selection of wines and the best duck I have ever eaten.

It is undoubtedly a very good restaurant, but falls short in a few ways. While the presentation and quality of ingredients are up to standard, the way by which the business is conducted leaves some to be desired. Dress codes are not adhered to, and some of the dishes are contrived and a case of heaping expensive ingredients and charging for it.

Beautiful and romantic setting with lots of history. The duck tasting menu is the obvious choice here. It‚Äôs pressed between golden blocks... doesn‚Äôt get more luxurious than this.
You‚Äôll be wowed by the wine selection and sommelier given there are over 500 pages of wine to choose from.
We were saddened we weren‚Äôt able to go to the salon downstairs without a reservation.
Excellent classic Parisian fare and friendly staff

I have been here multiple times and yet never reviewed it. Let's correct this travesty now!

This is an excellent restaurant! What else does one need to know?

The service is impeccable! They great you downstairs and make you comfortable (with champagne of course!) The the service when you go upstairs gets no reproach from me. My wife was very happy with the attention, their quickness to answer your requests and their knowledge of what you might want to eat that night. Though my father and I have always chosen to eat the "Caneton Presse."

The menu is mostly incredible dishes! My mother and wife has always gone with the a la carte. But my father and I share their signature dish. If you go there, you must have two people eat that dish. And you also have a card with the number of your caneton printed on it. I still have mine stashed in my desk right now.

The wine list is a wine lovers' dream! Splurge a bit and enhance your night further! Their sommelier has always  advised me to the greatest wine to pair with the various dishes!

The view from the restaurant is incredible. And it is very much fun to watch the bateau-mouche pass by on the Seine!

The only drawback: as you can guess, it's the price. A good evening for two people can go up to 2000 euros. But that is just me. Just tell your server and he/she will recommend what would fit you best. Especially when it involves wine!

Recommended!!!
Very enjoyable New Years dinner. Kitchen and service on a high level.
Exceptional cuisine, service and wine list (the biggest I've seen)! Sena River and Notre Dame views are only an extra for this impeccable traditional restaurant. It comes with a price!
Top notch service with wine list and enjoyable dishes to match. Duck dish specialty. Deserved to be among best in France. Great view too facing river. Highly recommended.

The epitome of French hotelerie, great service, over priced wines (only French) and old school cooking. Despite my comments, worth the visit, many times. The sun down sipping expensive Bordeaux is special
La Tour D'Argent is always a perfect evening. Wonderful food and wonderful hospitality.
Incredible place !! Food are amazing !! Service was just perfect cheerful and pleasant. We'll definitely come back.

Very nice place, well located but the "pressed duck" which is why the restaurant is famous for: is not on the menu, you need to preorder it so be careful. They do have best quality ingredients, but the prices for the wines (common and commercial wine brands) is really excessive. All food I tasted was nothing special really, but it is worth going there at least once in your life. Price per person ‚Ç¨150 to ‚Ç¨400.
The most amazing dinner I've ever had. Absolutely worth the price tag!
Stumbled across this and couldn't fault it..we went with the cote de boeuf and it is huge and fabulous.

La Tour D'Argent far exceeded my expectations of a beautiful lunch service in Paris over the River Seine with great views of Notre Dame de Paris. The staff is expertly attentive, and the food was exquisitely crafted! For those reviewers who would highlight the 'loss' of 2 of its Michelin stars - I would state that I personally experienced no lapse of service or quality of food whatsoever - it truly felt as good as they come.  At times in Paris, restaurants can have the view, but lack the execution - not at La Tour D'Argent!  The execution is flawless.  The wine list, which is deep enough for the greatest of connoisseurs, is also approachable.  Sure - there are gems in the wine list reaching into the most exclusive of pricing realms, but there are also accessible options for the special occasion splurge for those that generally would not eat at such a high-end restaurant.   My wife and I, on a 7-year anniversary trip - enjoyed reaching a little bit deeper to experience La Tour D'Argent and were not disappointed.  It will easily be remembered as the best meal, I've ever had in my life, affected only minimally by the epic location, and the gorgeous environment.  (Dress code detailed note:  I thought it prudent to make a note, because I know many reading these reviews are seeking it - La Tour D'Argent should be noted that for dinner service, formal attire makes the most sense - Coat + Tie for men, equivalent dressy attire for women).  Lunch service may have slightly more exception, but remember - they are putting out the best in red-carpet treatment and service - return the gesture.  Myself, I wore a blue suit coat, full button down white dress shirt, dress shoes, and extremely dark denim - I attempted modern-chic informal business - and I did not feel out of place.  Had I lacked the coat, I feel I would have felt out of place.  Even at lunch, men should have coats at La Tour D'Argent - blazer or otherwise.  My wife wore a chic sweater, and a darker denim pair of pants, paired with a perfect pair of heels.  (Most other women of the restaurant had on smart dresses, sweaters, or blazers that also suited the restaurant well).  I will not tell you that La Tour D'Argent will toss you over your outfit (outside of extremes such as torn denim, sneakers, athletic clothing, etc), but I can tell you, my description for our attire above had us comfortable at lunch, and I would guess it hits a minimum expectation.  Dress up! It can be fun!  Pack suits that travel well - wear your coat on the plane, fold it gently for transit - you can do it - and have a great time.  Ok, I'll wrap this up.  Suffice it to say - wonderful!  expert! Tres Magnifque!
Fine dining, they speak English.

This is my favorite restaurant in the whole world. Everything is perfect there, ambiance, service, food, wine, not to mention the restaurant¬¥s almost 500 years history and the view you get from there. If you¬¥re looking for a really special place for a special celebration, this is the place to be!
Leave it on the hands of St√©phane Trapier (Directeur de salle) and his brigade and you¬¥ll have an unforgetable experience!

I knew that I‚Äôd be impressed by the wine list (the largest in France) but the food was firing on all cylinders as well. The wine list has some real values to be found in some older vintages. We drank a white burgundy for that was listed at half what it‚Äôs listed for at retail. Go for lunch and request a table by the window for a killer view of Notre Dame.
Wonderful food was accompanied by poor service.  A highly anticipated evening resulted in a disappointing experience. Not up to standards of a restaurant group of such stature.

Whilst the entrees and mains were excellent, the dessert was horrible and very disappointing. The service was not good this time, as on our previous visit, as the staff were not as attentive and spent too much time talking loudly in little groups about what to do next and more and were not far from the tables.

Fine dining at its best, with the most exquisite quality and attention to all details.   The staff pampers you from the moment you arrive, with the most charming courtesy.
An experience to be cherished !
Beautiful, historic environment, perfect service.  Excellent classic dishes
It was the third time I visited, and I would give 5 stars each visit. Excellent service, who take good care of the guests. 5 star food and dessert
Excellent wait staff, wonderful menu choices and just a great spot for dinner right down the street from Notre Dame
The food was spectacularly good, and the venue, service, ambience and attention could not have been nicer.
We came here when it was rotisserie du beaujolais and it was amazing. Assuming its the same place with just a slight name change!
Just divine cuisine, staff and the sight is indeed unmatched. We spent a few hours there and it was magical.
So many stories that I read about this legendary place, the site is extremely elegant. They have an excellent wine but the dishes were not as fabulous as they said. I recommend L'ebauchoir.
Good quality good. Professional and classy waiter. Nice place
Food was great!

Sweeping views of the river, and with over half a million bottles of wine in the cellar.   Really expensive, and for a special occasion with a loved one, unless you have a huge expense account.

Exquisite service and food.
No words!

Tour D'Argent is a Paris classic and retains its charm.  It has lost a couple of its Michelin stars - not sure of all the reasons, but it still is charming with killer views, attentive service and top notch food.
Excellent food. Bistro version of the legendary restaurant on the corner.

Just returned from lunch at La tour d argent, golden wedding lunch, fantastic place and although not cheap it is good value for money. Staff very amiable and helpful! Will come back again for special occasion.

Food was pretty average service was very poor, and staff has some attitude, the said see the reality and that is more than half restaurant was empty on the weekend, will never go back again, I will not recommend to anyone. Waste of money and time
Sommelier has been very knowledgeable, helpful and service oriented. Completely opposite was the service staff - unpleasant, arrogant. We felt being judged.
Wonderful little french-cuisine restaurant. Have been here several times and am never disappointed. The duck confit is very tasty.
Excellent food and service!!!

Delicious food and a nice atmosphere. They even catered to my vegetarianism well (and didn't just serve me steamed vegetables, which happens a lot in France). I was with a very large group, which can be a challenge in a small restaurant, but they provided excellent service.
The most amazing view, service and food. An incredible gastronomic experience
The food and atmosphere are fantastic!
A fabulous culinary experience.  Le Inspiration was a delight, the wines well chosen and the service impeccable.
Restaurant that keeps up with tradition. Espectacular food, with an amazing view of Paris. Order the duck and you will get the actual duck number you are eating since the restaurant opened!
Nice classy restaurant. One of the oldest in Paris. Prices are expensive. Food is exquisite. If you can afford it, you should try.
Good wine and duck breast.
Absolutely Exquisite. Get the duck you won't regret it.
I go here everytime I'm in Paris. A true gem. Traditional bistro feel with superb food. The service is impeccable. Great value for a 5 star meal.
Insanely expensive and terrible food. Almost everything oversalted. No wonder the restaurant was half-empty. The only plus point is the good view over the cathedral Notre-Dame.
Best restaurant experience I've ever had. Simply perfect

T-H-E restaurant of Paris. if you haven't dined here you haven't realy been to Paris. can't elaborate on the atmosphere or menu because words cannot describe. just go. and pay a visit to the wine cellar at the end of your experience
Very cool place with attentive service. The whole duck for two was amazing.
Good duck and drinks, meat was overcooked but they quickly fixed it and gave a better meal.
fantastic restuarant. great food. great service.
"A fun place if you're with a crowd of amiable people, as we were.  No great shakes regarding food, decor, or service, but a pleasant way to spend in evening with friends who are not to fussyl"
9:30 pm reservation, seated at 9:35, ordered at 9:40, and first main was served at 10:40. Not sure I was eating or sleeping. Not impressed at all.
Amazing staffs and foods!
The food here is superb and the waitstaff are excellent.

Wish I could give 0 stars. The staff is extremely rude and rejected us for no good reasons.

The view is great, food is awesome (try the duck) and service is perfect - what else can you ask for?  The wine list is long, very long.
Excellent food and cooking typically French top service, most recommended. Also good price as it cost same as the average "Brasserie".

My husband and I had dinner here last night. We both had food poisoning this morning, throwing up in our hotel toilet. Food hygiene is most important thing for tourists. So in this case I wish I could give you 0/5.
The food is good. Nothing particularly mind blowing
Good service and even better food
Terrible service. It used to be a terrific place but it has changed a lot lately.
Amazingly beautiful. Food was not phenomenal but still pretty good. We went there for lunch and enjoyed the experience.
Mingle with the French and have an extraordinary meal here. Top choice for meats!

This was good.  Cousin of Tour d'Argent, which is Michelin-starred.  The 'poorer' cousin has excellent service and very good quality dishes.  Most of all, the service is excellent, sincerely cordial and engaging.  That always makes the food even better.  The roast chicken was especially a notch above.

Disappointing... don‚Äôt bother it‚Äôs not a cheap version of its prestigious owner...
Very avantage, yet over average prices..
The meal was delicious, my boyfriend and I had the chicken and the duck, unfortunately, we both got horrible food poisoning.  It has made for a very rough vacation.

The food here is excellent. Classic French cuisine and love the open plan kitchen. The steaks are juicy and flavourful and the rotisserie chickens are simply delicious! Absolutely superb. The Duck is fantastic and the staff are the friendliest in Paris. Highly recommended.

Went twice in one week because it was so good. Coq au vin was tremendous, as were the snails and the lamb shoulder. Desserts are great too.

Excellent food, service and the wine!

wine long for one life :)))))

If you only have time for one meal in Paris, eat it here and get the whole duck. It's the best duck you will ever have. You can choose how it's cooked and they can even do half an half. They recommend medium rare but my SO wanted medium. So they roasted it one side medium rare for me and one side medium for my SO. Super friendly service.
Fabulous cuisine with reasonable price.
Classic French cuisine served in style. Don't forget your coat or your second mortgage to pay for it.
If you go for the first time to the Tour d'argent with your girl friend reserve the lovers table just by the bow window with a direct view on Notre Dame

Wife and I had the lamb shoulder.  Was juicy and well seasoned.  Our table was too small to have the butcher block it is normally served on at the table the table so wait staff carved if and put it on a plate.  English menus available.
Wonderful, casual bistro. Be sure to stop by the bakery.
Excellent food and lovely waiters. Perfect place for a dinner.

Had an excellent diner in a traditional French rotisserie. Quality of meat is perfect with the caneton as speciality. Very friendly and careful staf: they really check the quality of the dishes before being served. Relaxed atmosphere with an open kitchen. This is like the Paris kitchen should be!

Le Tour D'Argent at one time had three Michelin Stars.  It now has one.  If one takes into account the recent transformation of  La Rotisserie D'Argent, it may be in the negative soon.  Le Rotisserie Beaujolais was the name of this restaurant the family owned until Andre Delair went Disney recently.  Note the tourist who give high marks.  Note the lack of Parisienne reviews and judge for yourself.  As an American who lives in Paris an was a steady customer who referred many to this establishement, I recently went to the new transformation of this restaurant and was horrified.  While the meat was done well, better now realize you have to order for two-you could get for one before Ms. Delair sold out to tourists or profit.  BTW, note all of the wine labeled by D'Argent, they even now make their own cheap sparking water (more profit naturally).  You want good pomme frites, go to McDonalds, it is honestly better there.  You want a great French dining experience, go to Le Reminet just down the street.  Felicitations Ms. Delair for destroying a very nice restaurant, mais I am sure it will be very profitable.

(Translated by Google) We had a pleasant evening at La Tour d'Argent, but we have mixed feelings about this dinner.
The positive points: very warm welcome and good service. The duck and fish on the menu were excellent. The view is obviously superb, even if we did not have the best table in terms of seating. The decoration is also very pretty.
The negative points in our opinion: the price of the cheese plate !! At ‚Ç¨ 30 a plate, with very small portions and from our experience of many starred restaurants before this one, we found this price excessive. The waiter made a mistake at the end of the meal by serving me sparkling water instead of plain water. Moreover, we do not know where the water came from, what brand it was, because we did not see any bottles, the water was directly served in a carafe (the customer should see the origin of the product that he receives). The foie gras looked delicious but we found the taste curious and didn't like it. Finally, the first bottle of wine we took (white) had a very particular taste, bland, probably an unusual taste! The sommelier answered our questions but did not offer to taste the wine. Obviously the staff suspected something abnormal, because we were not offered to take the rest of the bottle not consumed, unlike the bottle of red wine that we won.
In short, a beautiful experience but tinged with "incidents" which are not likely to convince me to return to this restaurant.

Thank you to the reservation service for transmitting the special messages (we were happy to blow out a candle, and my wife delighted to leave with a small gift).

My wife has a complicated allergy to foie gras: we were therefore unable to take the menu (for two) around duck. This is a great reason to come back as soon as possible to three! But rest assured, for those who are in this case, the menu offers many other possibilities (including numbered duck - ours 1 175 343) pre-cut at the table!
